Uses of Package
java.util.concurrent.locks

  • Packages that use java.util.concurrent.locks 
    Package Description
    java.awt  
    java.net  
    java.util.concurrent
    Utility classes commonly useful in concurrent programming.
    java.util.concurrent.locks
    Interfaces and classes providing a framework for locking and waiting for conditions that is distinct from built-in synchronization and monitors.
    javax.swing  
    javax.swing.plaf.nimbus  
  • Classes in java.util.concurrent.locks used by java.awt 
    Class and Description
    Condition
    Condition factors out the Object monitor methods (wait, notify and notifyAll) into distinct objects to give the effect of having multiple wait-sets per object, by combining them with the use of arbitrary Lock implementations.
    Lock
    Lock implementations provide more extensive locking operations than can be obtained using synchronized methods and statements.
  • Classes in java.util.concurrent.locks used by java.net 
    Class and Description
    ReentrantLock
    A reentrant mutual exclusion Lock with the same basic behavior and semantics as the implicit monitor lock accessed using synchronized methods and statements, but with extended capabilities.
  • Classes in java.util.concurrent.locks used by java.util.concurrent 
    Class and Description
    AbstractOwnableSynchronizer
    A synchronizer that may be exclusively owned by a thread.
    AbstractQueuedSynchronizer
    Provides a framework for implementing blocking locks and related synchronizers (semaphores, events, etc) that rely on first-in-first-out (FIFO) wait queues.
    Condition
    Condition factors out the Object monitor methods (wait, notify and notifyAll) into distinct objects to give the effect of having multiple wait-sets per object, by combining them with the use of arbitrary Lock implementations.
    Lock
    Lock implementations provide more extensive locking operations than can be obtained using synchronized methods and statements.
    ReentrantLock
    A reentrant mutual exclusion Lock with the same basic behavior and semantics as the implicit monitor lock accessed using synchronized methods and statements, but with extended capabilities.
  • Classes in java.util.concurrent.locks used by java.util.concurrent.locks 
    Class and Description
    AbstractOwnableSynchronizer
    A synchronizer that may be exclusively owned by a thread.
    AbstractQueuedLongSynchronizer
    A version of AbstractQueuedSynchronizer in which synchronization state is maintained as a long.
    AbstractQueuedLongSynchronizer.ConditionObject
    Condition implementation for a AbstractQueuedLongSynchronizer serving as the basis of a Lock implementation.
    AbstractQueuedLongSynchronizer.Node
    Wait queue node class.
    AbstractQueuedSynchronizer
    Provides a framework for implementing blocking locks and related synchronizers (semaphores, events, etc) that rely on first-in-first-out (FIFO) wait queues.
    AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.ConditionObject
    Condition implementation for a AbstractQueuedSynchronizer serving as the basis of a Lock implementation.
    AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.Node
    Wait queue node class.
    Condition
    Condition factors out the Object monitor methods (wait, notify and notifyAll) into distinct objects to give the effect of having multiple wait-sets per object, by combining them with the use of arbitrary Lock implementations.
    Lock
    Lock implementations provide more extensive locking operations than can be obtained using synchronized methods and statements.
    ReadWriteLock
    A ReadWriteLock maintains a pair of associated locks, one for read-only operations and one for writing.
    ReentrantLock.Sync
    Base of synchronization control for this lock.
    ReentrantReadWriteLock
    An implementation of ReadWriteLock supporting similar semantics to ReentrantLock.
    ReentrantReadWriteLock.ReadLock
    The lock returned by method ReentrantReadWriteLock.readLock().
    ReentrantReadWriteLock.Sync
    Synchronization implementation for ReentrantReadWriteLock.
    ReentrantReadWriteLock.Sync.HoldCounter
    A counter for per-thread read hold counts.
    ReentrantReadWriteLock.Sync.ThreadLocalHoldCounter
    ThreadLocal subclass.
    ReentrantReadWriteLock.WriteLock
    The lock returned by method ReentrantReadWriteLock.writeLock().
  • Classes in java.util.concurrent.locks used by javax.swing 
    Class and Description
    Lock
    Lock implementations provide more extensive locking operations than can be obtained using synchronized methods and statements.
  • Classes in java.util.concurrent.locks used by javax.swing.plaf.nimbus 
    Class and Description
    ReadWriteLock
    A ReadWriteLock maintains a pair of associated locks, one for read-only operations and one for writing.
